pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Ontario Premier Doug Ford | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Yesterday, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with Ontario Premier Doug Ford to discuss the railway blockades occurring across the country. The Prime Minister and the Premier discussed the significant impacts of these blockades in Ontario and across Canada.

Prime Minister Trudeau expressed the desire to work closely together toward a resolution as soon as possible, and thanked Premier Ford for the work Ontario is doing. The leaders noted that the Minister of Indigenous Services, Marc Miller, met with members of the Mohawk Nation on February 15, 2020 to have an open dialogue about the current situation in Tyendinaga and Wet’suwet’en. The two governments reiterated their desire to coordinate actions and exchange information.

The Prime Minister and the Premier also agreed on the importance of restoring operations on rail networks quickly, while ensuring that the situation is resolved in a peaceful manner and that dialogue can take place to address underlying issues.
